title: Man wearing body armor and wielding an assault rifle is shot dead by Apple Store guard in Dallas
text:
A security guard shot and killed an armed burglar inside a Dallas Apple store in the early hours of Tuesday morning, police have confirmed.

The shooting took place around 2:30am at the Apple Store on Knox Street, which was open because of overnight construction.

Police say the store’s back entrance had been left unlocked so construction workers could enter and leave the building at will.

The suspect, who was dressed in body armor and armed with an assault rifle, ran through the door 'in an attempt to commit a robbery,’ Sgt. Warren Mitchell said.

He then allegedly tried to 'disarm' a security guard sitting by the door.

The guard, a retired Dallas police officer, pulled out his weapon and fired multiple shots at the suspect.

The burglar, who has not yet been named, fled from the store but collapsed in an alley a short distance away.

He was taken to a nearby hospital where he was later pronounced dead, police said. No further details about the gunman or his injuries have been released.

Nobody else was harmed in the incident, officials confirmed. The case is now being investigated by the Dallas Police Department’s Special Investigation Unit.

The Apple store didn’t re-open its doors for trading on Tuesday. It’s expected to remain closed until Thursday.

Apple released a statement a short while later, confirming they are working closely with law enforcement regarding the incident, and expressed relief that no employees were harmed.

‘The loss of life is a tragedy and we are grateful that no one else was involved,’ a company spokesperson said.

‘Apple cares deeply about the safety of our customers and employees and we are committed to providing a secure environment for all who enter our stores.’
